comments:
Are you sure that your project is set up to compliance 1.5?
Are you using a 1.5 JDK?
This method is defined only in 1.5.
I tried with the compiler settings set to 1.5 and it works fine.
Closing as INVALID.

This is proof that i shouldn't be having this problem.   My professor is trying 
to pressure me into using JBUILDER.  I really hate that with a passion.  I much 
prefer eclipse. Should I update my eclipse platform?

Yes, you should definitely migrate your eclipse to 3.1 version to be able to
compile using 1.5 compliance.
There's no real possible update between 3.0.2 and 3.1, so go to eclipse
downloads page (http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/index.php) and get 3.1 version.
Install it at a new location (ie. different than 3.0.2 one...) and open your
workspace using this new version. Eclipse will do migration for you... :-)
Then, you can compile using 1.5 compliance and will not get this error again
HTH

traces.message: Unresolved compilation problem:   The method format(String, Object[]) in the type String is not  applicable for the arguments (String, int)
